summary: Henry B. Gonzalez is mentioned in the context of the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) payroll records. He appears as an authorizing official on payroll authorization forms for HSCA staff, indicating his role in approving or overseeing personnel matters within the committee. The documents primarily consist of administrative records related to HSCA staff employment, including payroll authorizations, salary adjustments, leave records, and related correspondence. The documents also include Final Determination Notifications from the Assassination Records Review Board regarding the postponement of certain information, specifically Social Security numbers, from HSCA staff payroll records to protect personal privacy. Gonzalez's involvement seems to be primarily administrative, related to the management and authorization of HSCA staff payroll.
significance: Henry B. Gonzalez's significance in the JFK assassination context lies in his role as an authorizing official within the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). His signature on payroll authorization forms indicates his involvement in the administrative and financial operations of the committee, which was tasked with investigating the assassination of President John F. Kennedy. While his role appears to be primarily administrative, his presence in these records connects him to the broader investigation and the individuals involved in it.
